item.title: scroll go bzzz
item.description:
scroll go bzzz

how to fix fedora waylands stupidly fast scrollspeeds

[20230202]


More of a niche kind of problem, but! if you are using Fedora Linux with the Wayland window manager on a thinkpad, you might run into "scrolling issues". For me the default scrolling speed using a trackpad is waayyy too sensitive.


And it's not like there is a simple config file or setting to change that. Anyway. After 2 weeks of searching the web, I finally found what I was looking for.


Clone this, and follow the instructions. Does work very reliably so far.
https://gitlab.com/warningnonpotablewater/libinput-config.git
